fields.name: asset
fields.description: Retrieve an asset by its unique identifier.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Return the total number of assets in the system.

fields.name: diagnose
fields.description: Perform a diagnosis of the database and blob store.

fields.name: locations
fields.description: Retrieve the list of locations and their associated asset count.

fields.name: lookup
fields.description: Look for an asset by the hash digest (SHA256).

fields.name: mediaTypes
fields.description: Retrieve the list of media types and their associated asset count.

fields.name: recent
fields.description:
Search for assets that were recently imported.

Recently imported assets do not have any tags, location, or caption, and
thus are waiting for the user to give them additional details.

fields.name: search
fields.description:
Search for assets by the given parameters.

The count indicates how many results to return in a single query,
limited to a maximum of 250. Default value is `10`.

The offset is useful for pagination. Default value is `0`.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: Retrieve the list of tags and their associated asset count.

fields.name: years
fields.description: Retrieve the list of years and their associated asset count.

fields.name: results
fields.description: The list of results retrieved via the query.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The total number of matching assets in the system, useful for pagination.

types.name: AssetInput
types.description: `AssetInput` is used to update the details of an asset.

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description: New set of tags to replace the existing set.

inputFields.name: caption
inputFields.description:
New caption to replace any existing value. Note that the caption text
may contain hashtags which are merged with the other tags, and may have
an @location that sets the location, if it has not yet defined.

inputFields.name: location
inputFields.description: New location to replace any existing value.

inputFields.name: datetime
inputFields.description:
A date/time that overrides intrinsic values; a `null` clears the custom
field and reverts back to the intrinsic value.

inputFields.name: mimetype
inputFields.description:
New media type, useful for fixing assets where the automatic detection
guessed wrong. Beware that setting a wrong value means the asset will
likely not display correctly.

inputFields.name: filename
inputFields.description: New filename to replace any existing value.

enumValues.name: BASE64
enumValues.description: Asset identifier was seemingly not valid base64.

enumValues.name: UTF8
enumValues.description: Asset identifier was seemingly not valid UTF-8.

enumValues.name: MISSING
enumValues.description: Asset file was not found at the expected location.

enumValues.name: SIZE
enumValues.description: Asset file size does not match database record.

enumValues.name: ACCESS
enumValues.description: Asset file was probably inaccessible (file permissions).

enumValues.name: DIGEST
enumValues.description: Asset file hash digest does not match database record.

enumValues.name: MEDIA_TYPE
enumValues.description: Asset record media_type property is not a valid media type.

enumValues.name: ORIGINAL_DATE
enumValues.description: Asset record original_date property missing or incorrect.

enumValues.name: EXTENSION
enumValues.description: Asset identifier/filename extension missing or incorrect.

types.name: AssetInputId
types.description: `AssetInputId` is used to update the details of an asset.

inputFields.name: id
inputFields.description: Identifier for the asset to be updated.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description:
GraphQL type kind

The GraphQL specification defines a number of type kinds - the meta type of a type.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description:
## Scalar types

Scalar types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries. Strings, numbers, and booleans are the built in types, and while it's possible to define your own, it's relatively uncommon.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Object types

The most common type to be implemented by users. Objects have fields and can implement interfaces.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description:
## Interface types

Interface types are used to represent overlapping fields between multiple types, and can be queried for their concrete type.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description:
## Union types

Unions are similar to interfaces but can not contain any fields on their own.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description:
## Enum types

Like scalars, enum types appear as the leaf nodes of GraphQL queries.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description:
## Input objects

Represents complex values provided in queries _into_ the system.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description:
## List types

Represent lists of other types. This library provides implementations for vectors and slices, but other Rust types can be extended to serve as GraphQL lists.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description:
## Non-null types

In GraphQL, nullable types are the default. By putting a `!` after a type, it becomes non-nullable.

types.name: Asset
types.description: An `Asset` defines a single entity in the storage system.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The unique asset identifier.

fields.name: checksum
fields.description: Hash digest of the contents of the asset.

fields.name: filename
fields.description: The original filename of the asset when it was imported.

fields.name: filesize
fields.description: The size in bytes of the asset.

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: The date/time that best represents the asset.

fields.name: mimetype
fields.description: The media type (nee MIME type) of the asset.

fields.name: tags
fields.description: The list of tags associated with this asset.

fields.name: userdate
fields.description: The date provided by the user.

fields.name: caption
fields.description: A caption attributed to the asset.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Location information for the asset.

types.name: LabeledCount
types.description: An attribute name and the number of assets it references.

fields.name: label
fields.description: Label for an asset attribute, such as a tag or location.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number of assets that are associated with this particular label.

types.name: BigInt
types.description: An integer type larger than the standard signed 32-bit.

types.name: SearchParams
types.description: `SearchParams` defines the various parameters by which to search for assets.

inputFields.name: tags
inputFields.description: Tags that an asset should have. All should match.

inputFields.name: locations
inputFields.description: Locations of an asset. At least one must match.

inputFields.name: after
inputFields.description:
Date for filtering asset results. Only those assets whose canonical date
occurs _on_ or _after_ this date will be returned.

inputFields.name: before
inputFields.description:
Date for filtering asset results. Only those assets whose canonical date
occurs _before_ this date will be returned.

inputFields.name: filename
inputFields.description: Find assets whose filename (e.g. `img_3011.jpg`) matches the one given.

inputFields.name: mimetype
inputFields.description: Find assets whose mimetype (e.g. `image/jpeg`) matches the one given.

inputFields.name: sortField
inputFields.description: Field by which to sort the results.

inputFields.name: sortOrder
inputFields.description: Order by which to sort the results.

fields.name: ingest
fields.description: Perform an import on all files in the uploads directory.

fields.name: repair
fields.description: Diagnosis and repair issues in the database and blob store.

fields.name: update
fields.description: Update the asset with the given values.

fields.name: bulkUpdate
fields.description:
Update multiple assets with the given values.

Returns the number of updated assets.

fields.name: assetId
fields.description: Identifier for the asset.

fields.name: errorCode
fields.description: One of the issues found with this asset.

types.name: SearchResult
types.description: An attribute name and the number of assets it references.

fields.name: id
fields.description: The identifier of the matching asset.

fields.name: filename
fields.description: The filename for the matching asset.

fields.name: mimetype
fields.description: Media type (formerly MIME type) of the asset.

fields.name: location
fields.description: The location for the matching asset, if available.

fields.name: datetime
fields.description: The date/time for the matching asset.
